comments:
Build ID: 3.3.1

Steps To Reproduce:
Using our product based on Eclipse 3.3.1, I ran into a situation where I could not delete any of the projects in my workspace due to an Invalid Thread Access error. In the .log file, I noticed this exception:

More information:

Moving to SWT for comment.

From the lines like:
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java:4364)
at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.RedrawWindow(Native Method)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.update(Display.java:4260)
at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:827)

it certainly looks like we're in the UI thread.  Since we didn't hop threads and this happened while eclipse was still running (not a shutdown scenario) how could we get in this scenario?  Multi-monitor?

PW
I have no idea how this could happen except that the code for Widget.checkWidget() is bogus.  I will investigate.

Do you see how this could be happening, given that there is only one display and Eclipse is not shutting down (ie. disposing the display)?

Is there more error stack somewhere?
*** Bug 210459 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

It seems that is it is somehow possible to get and invalid thread access from the user interface thread.  The only way I can see this happening is if the thread field in display becomes null.  Do we all agree?

(In reply to comment #6)
> It seems that is it is somehow possible to get and invalid thread access from
> the user interface thread.  The only way I can see this happening is if the
> thread field in display becomes null.  Do we all agree?

Or if the thread field in display is some other thread. I have no idea how this could happen, I'm just saying that it does not have to be null. Is there anything out of the ordinary installed in your Eclipse?
There's nothing I can think of that would be unusual about my Eclipse. I'm actually using our product which is based on Eclipse 3.3 and it runs in GUI mode.
Does your product create another Display or include native code that makes win32 calls?
*** Bug 212586 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
